text: Binary Search works only on sorted arrays and reduces search space by half.
Two pointers technique is useful when scanning arrays from both ends.
Always define a base case in recursion to avoid infinite calls.
Dynamic Programming stores subproblem results to avoid recomputation.
Binary search time complexity is O(log n).
UDP is a connectionless protocol that sends data without establishing a session, making it faster but unreliable.
TCP provides reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of data using acknowledgements and retransmissions.
UDP is used in real-time applications like video streaming and gaming where speed is more important than reliability.
TCP uses three-way handshake (SYN, SYN-ACK, ACK) to establish a reliable connection.
UDP does not guarantee delivery, order, or duplication protection.
A process is a program in execution, while a thread is the smallest unit of CPU scheduling.
Deadlock occurs when processes wait indefinitely for resources held by each other.
Indexes improve read performance but slow down writes due to maintenance overhead.
Encapsulation hides internal data and exposes only necessary functionality.
